intro: Sterigma brachypetalum, commonly known as the short-petaled bellflower, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pale blue. The plant features slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats. The flowers bloom in late spring or early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
